documents.document: People who fight fire with fire usually end up with ashes. -Abigail Van Buren
Dependence Quotes https://t.co/YGv3pimg7v
You need to make a commitment, and once you make it, then life will give you some answers. -Les Brown
We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars. -Oscar Wilde
My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither, but just enjoy your ice cream while it's on your plate; that's my philosophy. -T Wilder
No man is lonely while eating spaghetti; it requires so much attention. - Christopher Morley
Providence has hidden a charm in difficult undertakings, which is appreciated only by those who dare to grapple with them. -Swetchine
The path to cheerfulness is to sit cheerfully and to act and speak as if cheerfulness were already there. -William James
The first and best victory is to conquer self. To be conquered by self is, of all things, the most shameful and vile. -Plato
Live as if you were living a second time, and as though you had acted wrongly the first time. -Viktor E. Frankl
The difference between involvement & commitment is like ham & eggs. The chicken is involved; the pig is committed. -Navratilova
The Things I Get - Poem https://t.co/93mIHywTwA
You don't get paid for the hour. You get paid for the value you bring to the hour. -Jim Rohn
Endurance is one of the most difficult disciplines, but it is to the one who endures that the final victory comes. -Buddha
Whatever advice you give, be short. -Horace
Most of the successful people I've known are the ones who do more listening than talking. - Bernard Baruch
When you go in search of honey you must expect to be stung by bees. -Kenneth Kaunda
Many great ideas have been lost because people who had them could not stand being laughed at. -Anonymous
Deal with the faults of others as gently as your own. -Chinese Proverb
Debate is the death of conversation. -Emil Ludwig
Wishes expand in direct proportion to the resources available for their gratification. -Robert Dato

Experience is what you get when you don't get what you want. - Gregory Gretsch
The greatest quest in life is to reach one's potential. -Mychal Wynn
The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me. -Ayn Rand
It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it. -Aristotle

There is more to life than just existing and having a pleasant time. -Johann Friedrich Von Schiller
Pithy sentences are like sharp nails which force truth upon our memory. - Denis Diderot
What you have become is the price you paid to get what you used to want. -Mignon McLaughlin
There has never been a statue erected to honor a critic. -Zig Ziglar
Innovation Quotes https://t.co/Gn8GkOZGMj
Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting. - Napoleon Hill
"Surround yourself with only people who are going to lift you higher." -Oprah Winfrey
A man always has two reasons for what he does: a good one, and the real one. -J.P. Morgan
No man is ever whipped until he quits in his own mind. -Napoleon Hill
If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment. -Thoreau
A professional writer is an amateur who didn't quit. - Richard Bach
One today is worth two tomorrows. - Benjamin Franklin
Growth Quotes https://t.co/mF9RGbV5L3
Don't live down to expectations. Go out there and do something remarkable. -Wendy Wasserstein
We don't need more strength or more ability or greater opportunity. What we need is to use what we have. -Basil S. Walsh
We are continually faced by great opportunities brilliantly disguised as insoluble problems. - Lee Iacocca
Idleness travels very slowly, and poverty soon overtakes her. -Hunter
Life is too short to waste. Dreams are fulfilled only through action, not through endless planning to take action. -David Schwartz
"When inspiration does not come to me, I go halfway to meet it." - Sigmund Freud
It is with narrow-souled people as with narrow-necked bottles; the less they have in them the more noise they make in pouring it out. -Pope
Our chief want in life is somebodywho shall make us do what we can. -Ralph Waldo Emerson
If you would hit the mark, you must aim a little above it; Every arrow that flies feels the attraction of earth. -Longfellow
Joy Quotes https://t.co/EnU4t2rTNH
I think we consider too much the good luck of the early bird, and not enough the bad luck of the early worm. -FDR
You have to have a dream so you can get up in the morning. -Billy Wilder https://t.co/xpMKpCOKBd
The reputation of a thousand years may be determined by the conduct of one hour. -English proverb
"We cannot hold a torch to light another's path without brightening our own." -Ben Sweetland
Someone's opinion of you does not have to become your reality. -Les Brown
In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt. -Margaret Atwood
We cannot rise higher than our thought of ourselves. - Orison Swett Marden
We decieve ourselves when we fancy that only weakness needs support. Strength needs it far more. -Swetchine
The most successful people are those who are good at plan B. -James Yorke
Better to master one mountain than a thousand foothills. -William A. Ward
What Makes You Come Alive https://t.co/txDNBEyMij
Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things. -Henry Ward Beecher
"The world is good-natured to people who are good-natured." -William Makepeace Thackeray
Never be afraid to take on a really tough problem. When you solve it, the benefits will be that much greater. -Carl Gerstacker
Anger ventilated often hurries towards forgiveness; anger concealed often hardens into revenge. -Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton
If you act like you know what you're doing, you can do anything you want...except neurosurgery. -John Lowenstein
I care not so much what I am in the opinion of others as what I am in my own; I would be rich of myself & not by borrowing. -Montaigne

Let your dream devour your life, not your life devour your dream. -Antoine de St-ExupÃ©ry

The successful person makes a habit of doing what the failing person doesn't like to do. -Thomas Edison
Your actions, and your action alone, determines your worth. -Johann G. Fichte
You can either give in to negative feelings or fight them, and I'm of the belief that you should fight them. -Dr. Ruth Westheimer
It is necessary for you to learn from others' mistakes. You will not live long enough to make them all yourself. -Hyman Rickover
If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success. -John D. Rockefeller
Hope is a good breakfast but a bad supper. -Francis Bacon
If you make yourself into a doormat, people will wipe their feet on you. -unknown
Success is not measured by the heights one attains, but by the obstacles one overcomes in its attainment. -Booker T. Washington
Successful people are not gifted; they just work hard, then succeed on purpose. -G.K. Nielson

Failure is usually the line of least persistence. -Wilfred Beaver

"The man least dependent upon the morrow goes to meet the morrow most cheerfully." -Epicurus

You've got to say, I think that if I keep working at this and want it badly enough I can have it. It's called perseverance. -Lee Iacocca
